Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bac2A W10 (Bac2A analog, synthetic AMPs, Arg-rich, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution,  animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (91.67%) toBac2AR: 33%; V=I=A: 25%.Activity: active against P. aeruginosa H103 (MIC 16 uM), E. coli (MIC 4 uM), S. enterica ssp. Typhimurium or S. Typhimurium (MIC 8 uM). S. aureus ATCC25923 (MIC 8 uM), S. epidermidis clinical strain (MIC 2 uM), E. faecalis ATCC29212 (MIC 4 uM), and C. albicans (MIC 8 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Hilpert K, Volkmer-Engert R, Walter T, Hancock RE.2005
Literature Information.Title: High-throughput generation of small antibacterial peptides with improved activity
